text: The Jeffrey Epstein Situation Unrelated to daily trading and investing, it is my view that the Epstein affair has the potential of roiling American industry and politics as well as Wall Street. Palm Beach, Florida is actually a

very small town and word gets around quickly. As a resident of Palm Beach - where Epstein resided - I believe I have some understanding of the depth of his relationships and his financial modus operandi. I had a similar familiarity of investors (and other details) of the Bernie

Madoff scheme - for some of the same reasons (locale and my social relationships). The nature of Epstein's deeds (that he was jailed for) is heinous and I don't plan to discuss this any further. But there will likely be broad and unpleasant reverberations.
Some stocks and certainly some reputations may take large hits in the time ahead.

@tomkeene @business I will take the other side of Bob Albertson's argument: In banking its always the Bob Rubin Trade Rule. Banking is about hiding tail risks and the accumulation of tail exposures. In the process banks claim they are "safe". But, society pays for the blowups.
